intro: Centaurium pulchellum subsp. laxiflorum, commonly known as the slenderflower mouse-ear, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. The species is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in open, disturbed sites.
